section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.intro: Swiss Consult Hub (hereinafter "we", "our" or "Swiss Consult Hub") is committed to protecting the privacy and personal data of its clients and website visitors. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, store and protect your personal data in accordance with the Swiss Federal Data Protection Act (FDPA) and the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), where applicable.

section2.title: 2. Personal Data Collected
section2.intro: We collect various categories of personal data to provide our consulting services:

subsection1.title: 2.1 Identifying Data
items: First and last name
Email address
Phone number
Postal address (street, city, postal code, canton)
Date of birth (for medical and insurance consulting)

subsection2.title: 2.2 Professional Data
items: Company name
Job position
Industry sector
Professional experience (for employment consulting)

subsection3.title: 2.3 Sensitive Data (collected only with explicit consent)
items: Credit Consulting: Financial amounts, credit history, assets
Insurance Consulting: Health status, lifestyle habits
Medical Consulting: Medical data, pathologies, therapies (highest confidentiality)
Tax Consulting: Tax code, income, tax returns
Legal Consulting: Sensitive legal information

subsection4.title: 2.4 Technical Data
items: IP address
Browser type and version
Operating system
Device used
Pages visited and time spent
Cookies and tracking technologies (see Cookie Policy)

subsection5.title: 2.5 Attached Documents
items: Personal documents (ID card, residence permit)
Pay slips and employment contracts
Bank statements and financial documents
Medical reports (treated with highest confidentiality)
Tax and legal documents

section3.title: 3. Processing Purposes
section3.intro: Your personal data is processed for the following purposes:
items: Provide consulting services: Credit, insurance, real estate, employment, legal, medical and tax consulting
Follow-up communications: Updates on request status, appointments, documentation
Service improvement: Analysis and improvement of service quality
Legal and tax compliance: Compliance with Swiss and European regulations
Fraud prevention: Identity verification and fraud prevention activities
Marketing (consent only): Newsletters, personalized offers, promotional communications

section4.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
section4.intro: The processing of your personal data is based on the following legal bases:
items: Contract: To provide the requested consulting services
Consent: For marketing communications and processing of sensitive data
Legal obligation: For compliance with tax, legal and industry regulations
Legitimate interest: For service improvement and fraud prevention

section5.title: 5. Data Recipients
section5.intro: Your personal data may be shared with:
items: Internal team: Authorized Swiss Consult Hub consultants and operators
Professional partners: Lawyers, accountants, doctors, financial advisors (only to provide the requested service)
Service providers:
serviceProviders: File storage: Cloudinary (for attachments and documents)
section5.authorities: Competent authorities: Only if required by law (tax, judicial authorities)
section5.noteText: All recipients are contractually obliged to process personal data in compliance with data protection regulations.

section6.title: 6. International Data Transfers
section6.intro: Your data is primarily stored in Switzerland. In some cases, it may be transferred to service providers located in third countries (e.g. Cloudinary for file storage). In such cases, we ensure that appropriate protective measures are adopted, such as:
items: EU standard contractual clauses
Adequacy decisions
Privacy Shield certifications (where applicable)

section7.title: 7. Your Rights
section7.intro: In accordance with the FDPA and GDPR, you have the following rights:

subsection1.title: 7.1 Right of Access
subsection1.text: You can request a copy of all personal data we hold about you.

subsection2.title: 7.2 Right to Rectification
subsection2.text: You can request the correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.

subsection3.title: 7.3 Right to Erasure
subsection3.text: You can request the deletion of your data, subject to legal retention obligations.

subsection4.title: 7.4 Right to Data Portability
subsection4.text: You can request the export of your data in a standard electronic format.

subsection5.title: 7.5 Right to Object
subsection5.text: You can object to the processing of your data for marketing purposes.

subsection6.title: 7.6 Right to Restriction
subsection6.text: You can request the restriction of processing in certain circumstances.

subsection7.title: 7.7 How to Exercise Your Rights
subsection7.intro: To exercise your rights, you can:
items: Complete the online form
Send an email to: dpo@swissconsulthub.ch
Contact us by phone: +41 412 420 442
subsection7.noteText: We will respond to your request within 30 days.

section8.title: 8. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section8.intro: We use cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience on our site. For detailed information, please consult our Cookie Policy.
items: Essential Cookies: Necessary for site operation (always active)
Analytics Cookies: To analyze site usage (require consent)
Marketing Cookies: For targeted advertising (require consent)
section8.management: You can manage your cookie preferences in the cookie settings.

section9.title: 9. Data Security
section9.intro: We adopt appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data:

subsection1.title: 9.1 Technical Measures
items: Encryption: HTTPS for all communications, bcrypt for passwords
Firewall: Server and database protection
Backup: Regular and secure backups
Updates: Always up-to-date software

subsection2.title: 9.2 Organizational Measures
items: Limited access: Only authorized personnel can access data
Training: Regular staff training on data protection
Logging: Tracking access to sensitive data
Procedures: Documented procedures for data management

subsection3.title: 9.3 Breach Notification
subsection3.text: In the event of a data breach that poses a high risk to your rights and freedoms, we will notify you promptly and inform the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).

section10.title: 10. Retention Period
section10.intro: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary:
items: Consulting data: 10 years (legal and tax obligations)
Medical data: 10 years (legal obligations)
Marketing data: Until consent is withdrawn
Cookies: According to duration specified in Cookie Policy
Security logs: 12 months
section10.conclusion: At the end of the retention period, data is securely deleted, except for longer legal retention obligations.

section11.title: 11. Minors
section11.text: Our services are not intended for individuals under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from minors without parental or legal guardian consent.

section12.title: 12. Privacy Policy Changes
section12.text1: We may periodically update this Privacy Policy to reflect regulatory changes or changes to our services. The date of the last update is indicated at the top of the page. We invite you to consult this page regularly.
section12.text2: In case of substantial changes, we will inform you via email or through a notification on the site.

section13.title: 13. Contact
section13.intro: For any questions about this Privacy Policy or the processing of your data:

section14.title: 14. Complaints
section14.intro: If you believe that the processing of your data violates data protection regulations, you can file a complaint or contact the competent authority:

authority.title: Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)

footer.compliance: This Privacy Policy complies with the Swiss Federal Data Protection Act (FDPA) and the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

section1.title: 1. What Are Cookies
section1.paragraph1: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone) when you visit a website. Cookies allow the site to recognize your device and store some information about your preferences or past actions.
section1.paragraph2: This Cookie Policy explains how Swiss Consult Hub uses cookies and similar technologies on the website www.swissconsulthub.ch and how you can manage your preferences.

section2.title: 2. Types of Cookies
section2.intro: Cookies can be classified based on different characteristics:

subsection1.title: 2.1 By Duration
items: Session Cookies: Deleted when you close the browser
Persistent Cookies: Remain on the device for a defined period of time

subsection2.title: 2.2 By Owner
items: First-Party Cookies: Set by Swiss Consult Hub
Third-Party Cookies: Set by other sites (e.g., Google Analytics)

subsection3.title: 2.3 By Purpose
items: Essential Cookies: Necessary for site functionality
Performance Cookies: Collect information about site usage
Functionality Cookies: Store your preferences
Targeting Cookies: Used for targeted advertising

section3.title: 3. Essential Cookies (Always Active)
section3.intro: These cookies are strictly necessary for the functioning of the site and cannot be disabled. They do not require your consent.

cookies.name: sch_auth_token
cookies.purpose: JWT authentication token for admin access

section3.noteText: These cookies do not track your activities on other sites and are used exclusively to ensure the proper functioning of our site.

section4.title: 4. Analytics Cookies (Require Consent)
section4.intro: These cookies help us understand how visitors use the site, collecting information anonymously. We use this information to improve the site and user experience.

subsection1.title: 4.1 Google Analytics
subsection1.description: We use Google Analytics to analyze site usage. Google Analytics collects information such as pages visited, time spent on the site, and visitor origin.
subsection1.privacyLink: For more information about Google Analytics and privacy, visit:

subsection2.title: 4.2 IP Anonymization
subsection2.description: We have enabled IP address anonymization on Google Analytics, so your full IP address is never stored.

section5.title: 5. Marketing Cookies (Require Consent)
section5.intro: These cookies are used to show advertising relevant to you and your interests. They can also be used to limit the number of times you see an advertisement and to measure the effectiveness of advertising campaigns.
section5.noteText: We do not currently use marketing cookies. If we decide to use them in the future, we will update this policy and request your explicit consent.

section6.title: 6. Third-Party Cookies
section6.intro: Some cookies are set by third-party services that appear on our pages. Swiss Consult Hub does not control the setting of these cookies.
section6.recommendation: We recommend consulting the privacy policies of these services to understand how they use your data.

section7.title: 7. Other Tracking Technologies
section7.intro: In addition to cookies, we use other technologies to collect information:

subsection1.title: 7.1 Web Beacons (Pixels)
subsection1.description: Small graphic images used to track page views and email opens.

subsection2.title: 7.2 Local Storage
subsection2.description: HTML5 technology that allows data to be stored locally in the browser. We use local storage for:
items: User preferences (theme, language)
Authentication tokens
Temporary session data

subsection3.title: 7.3 Session Storage
subsection3.description: Similar to local storage, but data is deleted when you close the browser. Used for temporary browsing data.

section8.title: 8. How to Manage Cookies
section8.intro: You have several options to manage and control cookies:

subsection1.title: 8.1 Site Cookie Settings
subsection1.description: You can change your cookie preferences at any time by visiting the

subsection2.title: 8.2 Browser Settings
subsection2.description: Most browsers allow you to control cookies through settings. Here's how to do it in the most common browsers:

browsers.name: Google Chrome
browsers.instructions: Settings ‚Üí Privacy and security ‚Üí Cookies and other site data

browsers.name: Mozilla Firefox
browsers.instructions: Options ‚Üí Privacy & Security ‚Üí Cookies and Site Data

browsers.name: Microsoft Edge
browsers.instructions: Settings ‚Üí Privacy, search, and services ‚Üí Cookies and site permissions

subsection3.title: 8.3 Third-Party Tools
subsection3.description: You can also use third-party tools to manage cookies:

subsection4.title: 8.4 Private Mode
subsection4.description: Most browsers offer a private/incognito browsing mode that automatically deletes cookies when you close the browser window.

section9.title: 9. Effects of Disabling Cookies
section9.intro: Disabling cookies may affect your experience on our site:

subsection1.title: 9.1 Essential Cookies
subsection1.description: If you disable essential cookies, some site features may not work properly:
effects: You will not be able to access the admin area
Your preferences will not be saved

subsection2.title: 9.2 Analytics Cookies
effects: We will not be able to improve the site based on your preferences
We will not know which content is most useful

subsection3.title: 9.3 Marketing Cookies
effects: You will still see advertising, but less relevant to you
You may see the same advertisement multiple times

section10.title: 10. Cookies and Mobile Devices
section10.intro: Cookies work the same way on mobile devices. You can also manage cookies on mobile devices:

section11.title: 11. Cookie Policy Updates
section11.paragraph1: We may update this Cookie Policy periodically to reflect changes in the technologies used or in regulations. The date of the last update is indicated at the top of the page.
section11.paragraph2: We recommend that you regularly consult this page to stay informed about how we use cookies.
